summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 between federal prosecutors discussing sealed envelopes containing pleadings with minor victim names found in Epstein case files from the Southern District of Florida. The emails coordinate the review and opening of these sealed documents.

persons.name: Melanie Wheeler
persons.context: Sends photographs of sealed envelopes from Epstein files to a prosecutor, identifying their source boxes.

events.title: Discovery of Sealed Envelopes
events.description: A vendor provides photographs of two sealed envelopes (marked 'SEALED DOCUMENT' and 'CONFIDENTIAL') found in the SDFL Epstein files, addressed to an AUSA from a law firm.

events.title: Authorization to Open Envelopes
events.description: Prosecutors authorize the opening of sealed envelopes containing pleadings that have minor victim names, confirming they can be scanned for review.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Sealed envelopes containing pleadings with minor victim names were discovered in Epstein case files from the Southern District of Florida.
The envelopes were marked 'SEALED DOCUMENT' and 'CONFIDENTIAL' and were addressed to an AUSA from a law firm.
Prosecutors coordinated to open and scan the contents of these sealed envelopes for review in September 2020.
The document highlights ongoing post-conviction review and handling of sensitive victim information in the Epstein case.
